thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger ready to snub China pay-day | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger ready to snub China pay-day | Daily Mail Online

author: Sami Mokbel For The Daily Mail
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger ready to snub China pay-day | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 260 shares Any move to China or the Middle East would see Wenger offered deals worth considerably more than the Â£8million-per-year he already earns at the Emirates Stadium. However, it is understood Wenger would prefer to manage in one of Europe's top leagues if he leaves north London at the end of the season. Luiz Felipe ScolarI (far right) is manager of Guangzhou Evergrande and he has attracted stars Wenger was linked with the vacancy at Real Madrid before it was filled by Zinedine Zidane Despite Arsenal's recent lack of silverware, Wenger's reputation is largely intact on the continent. Indeed, Sportsmail understands Wenger was considered by Real Madrid following Rafa Benitez's departure last season. Wenger was made aware of the interest, though the Spanish club eventually appointed Zinedine Zidane. And while a move to China or the Middle East would suit Wenger's bank balance, the Frenchman's competitive nature means remaining in Europe is a far more appealing option. Wenger is in no rush to make an announcement over his future despite growing speculation A significant section of Arsenal supporters would now like to see a change of management Wenger will assess the managerial landscape before making his final decision. Jobs could crop up at Paris Saint-Germain, who have courted Wenger for years, and Barcelona. Both roles would appeal to Wenger, though signing a new two-year deal at the Emirates Stadium remains the Frenchman's No 1 option. However, Wenger is well aware that he's a divisive figure among supporters and signing a deal will only serve to fuel the growing disquiet surrounding his role as manager. RELATED ARTICLES
